page.title: 09Nether Stowey: Post Office
page.content: The village has had its own post office for many years. It is now part of the Spar Grocery Shop. Their main business is of postal services for letters and parcels, but they also deal with motor vehicle and television licences and pensions. No postal deliveries or collections are made by this post office. These services are run by the main sorting office at Bridgwater. About twelve postmen cover this area in shifts, driving red post office vans. There are two postal collections and deliveries for most of the village on weekdays, one on Saturday. The new housing estate only receives one delivery daily. Approximately 80% of homes have a telephone and many have a second telephone. The pushbutton telephone is becoming popular. Bridgwater is our local exchange.
